item.title: Getting started
item.author: anant.dalela@gmail.com (Anant Dalela)
item.description:
Not much to see here yet, just some housekeeping notes. This blog is built with Hugo and published using Github Pages. I started with this theme, and made some minor tweaks:

  • linked a Javascript plug-in called Littlefoot 1
  • edited RSS parameters so the feed now includes the full body of each post (*feed reader nods approvingly*) 2
  • messed around with fonts for too long (highly recommend Matthew Butterick’s ‘Practical Typography,’ which you can read online, and shout out to the creaters of google webfonts helper)

Still feeling my way around; my biggest takeaway so far is Hugo is fast. hugo server locally deploys your site in milliseconds, and updates live as you edit the source files.

  1. It’s a lightweight version of Bigfoot.js, which creates footnotes that look like this. ↩︎

  2. If you use a feed reader are a you feed reader reader or just a feed reader? I’d guess both. Yeah, there’s a reason these footnotes are hidden. ↩︎
